website_summaries.verdict: WWE 2K16 is an enjoyable game for wrestling fans, but you may be better off waiting for a price drop.
pros: WWE 2K16 features the largest roster in the game's history
You can create a custom superstar and fight through the wrestling ranks in the MyCareer mode, or relive Stone Cold Steve Austin's rise to the top in a special Showcase mode
cons: Some prominent characters are missing, and graphics are hit or miss
The game still has its fair share of bugs

customer_reviews.title: Still think the older version were better
customer_reviews.text: I usually write long reviews, but for some games, I'm going to write more of a short and direct review 8/10 Since the last one I played was 2k8, there have been major changes to the game. 8/10 In-depth fighting input / graphics slightly upgraded / more characters / superstar storyline is better / submission is little biased to the person who started it there are modes, but I just played the regular matches. Also, the created superstar has been a mixed feeling for me. On one hand, it has multiple move-set for your fighter. But I realized they took out the create the finisher. I really hope 2k17 has that.
customer_reviews.author: The Notorious Tran

customer_reviews.title: Best WWE Game since NO MERCY
customer_reviews.text: Arguably the best WWE game ever. Nothing will ever compare to the nostalgia of NO MERCY but this is right up there. Great graphics (with the exception of the unusually large mouths on everyone), best gameplay in years and fantastic roster. I would have liked to see more of the Divas on there but with the community created players and future DLC's, I am sure they will make up for it. The only downside of the game I have is the new Submission system which is frustrating to say the least. I have been playing it non-stop for weeks now and it doesn't let up. Great created character gameplay and replay value is EXTREMELY high.
customer_reviews.author: Levi M.

customer_reviews.title: Kinda disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am really trying to enjoy this game but I seem to keep having trouble with the game play I bought this game just because there was nothing else I thought good enough to buy on the ps4 it's kind of depressing because I am a huge fan of the legendary wrestlers and this game does have a great roster i personally don't care about graphics in games the gameplay is what is most important I am going to continue trying to get the hang of this game just because my love for classic wrestling and the 30 dollars I paid for it good luck to whoever buys this game hope I was helping and u have fun playing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent game I guess. Last WWE game I've played ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent game I guess. Last WWE game I've played. If you followed wrestling during the austin era then you're just replaying matches you've seen a dozen times. Other than that is is the same game the last 2 years in a row with new people, a new showcase and a title making mode. 2k has a lot of work to do if they are going to save this franchise.
customer_reviews.author: Charley

customer_reviews.title: coming from WWF NO MERCY..
customer_reviews.text: I was kinda worried if this game would be any good since my last wrestling favorite was WWF NO MERCY from the n64 era. But the jump from then to now was smooth.. All in all its a fun game and I'm glad I bought it. I read alot of reviews and apparently this year's game is on the right track to making them better. Also the showcase mode in this is quite nastallgic. I hope one day, current wrestling can top the..''Attitude era''.
customer_reviews.author: Bilal Al amin Claybrone

customer_reviews.title: Graphics are good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son, who is a diehard WWE fan. He likes the career mode in particular, as well as the variety of superstars available. He remarked that the graphics were better than previous versions he has played, but I didn't think they looked much better than the PS3 versions from previous releases. Still, he was entertained for the majority of Christmas day with it, so no arguments from me.
customer_reviews.author: Corey H.

customer_reviews.title: *Le Sigh
customer_reviews.text: What happened to this series? I expected so much more than what I got. Sure the gameplay is fine but it seems that more that improves in the WWE series, the more it lacks and takes away from what previously made it great. No custom music, create a move (which needed to be overhauled), no match modifications, I could go on. I was not impressed. I would say I was unimpressed in fact and have grown to say that I am whelmed by the overall game. Sad because 2k games kills when it comes to NBA games.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Game is pretty fun and addicting
customer_reviews.text: Game is pretty fun and addicting. Roster is incredible. Pretty extensive and awesome create modes! The career mode moves a little slow and is a bit repetitive. Wish there were more than just the stone cold story mode, but hey maybe in an expansion? Overall fun game. Fun solo but definitely a lot funner with others. The online mode is decent but i feel could be a bit better
customer_reviews.author: JahRebel RastafariTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good game.
customer_reviews.text: I play this game for hours. I've purchase WWE's game each year. This is one of the best as far as graphics, refined gameplay, story and roster. The cons are it's glitchy/doesn't jive well with the wireless Ps4 controllers, WWE's servers are always down as with the 2015 installment and I miss the create-a-finisher option. WWE16 does, unforunately, continue the trend of DLC. It sucks. Just charge me $100 for the full game instead of piecemilling it. It's fun but not without it's problems - I'll continue playing it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Lee

customer_reviews.title: Same old gameplay
customer_reviews.text: Great roster in 2k16 featuring some iconic legends and modern faces. If you're a WWE fan and looking to buy any time after 2018, look for a newer game that has added features.
customer_reviews.author: Chazz

customer_reviews.title: Good game but.....
customer_reviews.text: A good game. Not much to say other then it’s the same as ever other 2KWWE game.
customer_reviews.author: Squirtle11287

customer_reviews.title: This has been a fun game. I am glad they have included a ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been a fun game. I am glad they have included a vast roster that includes many of the legends I grew up watching. After I beat the 2k Showcase I found that the game just wasn't as fun. I really enjoyed the showcase, but the re-playability is just not there for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nolen

customer_reviews.title: Very average
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the Stone Cold Steve Austin story mode, but beyond that the game was very dry. As someone who hadn't played a wrestling game since the Nintendo 64, I felt quite let-down by the modern era.

customer_reviews.title: Good if its like $5
customer_reviews.text: Game came in great condition , but the gameplay is shorty collision problems abound as characters look jerky as they fight for who went first, plenty of game modes and characters in this wanna be brawling bumbling game it's good if it's cheap
customer_reviews.author: Adampop1203

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: WWE 2K16 is by far the most improved wrestling video game this year compared to WWE 2K15. The graphics and wrestler appeals look very descriptive and are amazing. The controls could take time to adjust based on the new grappling feature in the game, moving away from fast paced action from early 2k games. A very big roster indeed. Sound is good overall. More commentary could have been more involved during the matches. Overall I give this game a 8.4 out of 10. Thanks Amazon for such great service on this product.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!

My only complaint is the submission system. I can't pull of a damn submission at all. Apart from that I think the game is amazing! Go buy it! I only wish they had a Special Referee game mode where you could be the referee and call DQ's.

customer_reviews.title: Wrestling fanatic who hates wrestling games

Its to technical, the controls are stiff, the commentary sucks, career mode takes forever to get started, the showcase mode is played out and all the fun of past wrestling games are gone. Speaking ONLY for myself, I don't want to buy a game and recreate what I see on T.V. I want to buy a game and enjoy myself IN ANY WAY I SEE FIT. Too many restrictions, not enough freedom gameplay. I think WWE 2K17 will only be worse.

customer_reviews.title: Realistic Sim, not Arcade style
customer_reviews.text: Plain and simple, this is a REALISTIC pro wrestling simulation, not an arcade fighter. This game features slower pacing, limited stamina, rechargeable reversals and reversals. This leads to very realistic gameplay. This is a wrestling game for wrestling fans, casuals beware
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Super fun game
customer_reviews.text: Super fun game. It's been a while since the last time I'd played a wresting video game (not since it was on the original Playstation) so the whole reversal system took a while to get accustomed to, but I picked it up eventually. The roster is pretty decent featuring a lot of familiar faces and a lot of new faces. Probably the best feature of the game is the stuff you can download that other players have created. Character creation isn't my strong suit, since I don't have a lot of patience for the thing. I'm glad I picked it up.
customer_reviews.author: Thoeun Ke

customer_reviews.title: Best way to purchase Ps4 games
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my 14 year old son for a gift and received before estimated delivery date. Well packaged and I managed to snag it at a great discount. Had I purchased this at a retail store that starts with a W, I think most people know what store I'm referring to, I wld have paid an additional $20 plus. Definitely wld recommend to family and friends and will continue ordering games from here. Needless to say, my son was extremely happy with the game and none the wiser of the huge discount I received. lol

customer_reviews.title: Try it out........I guess
customer_reviews.text: New to WWE 2k after playing SvR. Hit or miss type game when it comes to wrestling games. Was a miss this time. Game weighs heavily on Reversals......HEAVILY. There are some opponents that reverse literally everything. If you played the Smackdown vs Raw games you know that there were times you could manually reverse by tapping a strike button at the right time and your character would throw an elbow or something depending on where he or she was standing. If you are used to that you might not like this game. This is just my take on it and others might like the way this game plays.

customer_reviews.title: The game MIGHT be good, but since half of it didn't work, I'll never know
customer_reviews.text: Basing this review off the fact that only half of the game that actually worked. Installed it and the following parts did not work, regardless of the variety of thing I tried: - Career Mode - Customer Creations - None of the "create" features, including Superstars, show, ring, championship, etc. Contacted customer service three times and their "solution" was to wipe clean my PS4 and re-install the game. Okay, let me completely throw away my progress on a dozen other games for your poorly designed game. No thanks, 2K! Returned the game instead and we'll very likely pass on future 2K offerings. Their customer service is worthless.

product_meta.title: WWE 2K16 - PlayStation 4
product_meta.description:
WWE 2K16

Get in the ring and Raise Some Hell with WWE 2K16! The undisputed champion of wrestling games returns with the biggest roster in WWE games history and the 'Texas Rattlesnake' Stone Cold Steve Austin as its Cover Superstar! Play as your favorite Superstars from the past, present and future and experience the most authentic, comprehensive, in-your-face WWE video game.
feature_bullets: Biggest Roster in WWE Video Game History:The biggest roster in WWE video game history! Play as over 120 unique characters and Raise Some Hell with your favorite WWE and NXT Superstars, Divas, Legends and more.

Improved and Refined Gameplay:2K16’s core wrestling gameplay is smoother and more responsive than ever, with thousands of new animations, enhancements in chain wrestling, new working holds and reversals to deliver the most fun and authentic WWE experience to date.

2K Showcase:Relive and play through some of the most iconic WWE matches and moments of all-time in 2K16’s single player story campaign, 2K Showcase. Complete objectives to unlock legendary characters, gear, match types, and unlockables from WWE history.

New Creation Suite Features:Utilize 2K’s best-in-class Creation Suite to develop your WWE Universe, including options to create, customize and compete with unique Superstars, Divas, Arenas, Championships and more. Upload your creations and share with the WWE Universe online!

3-Man Commentary Team:For the first time ever, WWE 2K16 will feature a 3-man commentary featuring Michael Cole, John ‘Bradshaw’ Layfield and Jerry ‘The King’ Lawler! With thousands of additional commentary lines in the game this year, 2K16 will feature the most authentic WWE commentary to date.
WWE Universe:WWE Universe has been improved drastically with new core systems to have a richer and more dynamic WWE.
